intro: Lepidagathis javanica var. montana, commonly known as the mountain lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
